name: Maggie Makar
content: Maggie Makar Home Publications How to join Students Teaching 6.S897 (MIT) ML whirlwind (MIT) CSE 598 (UM) Maggie Makar Assistant professor in CSE, University of Michigan E-mail: mmakar [at] umich [dot] edu Physical location: BBB 3769 Twitter: @Maggiemakar Mastodon: mmakar@mastodon.social CV: As of Sept 2022 Google scholar profile About me I study machine learning, causal inference, and the intersection between the two. My work focuses on building data-efficient causal inference methods in resource-constrained settings, and building robust predictive ML models using ideas from causality. Prior to UM, I completed my PhD in CSAIL, MIT and my bachelors degree in math and economics at Umass Amherst. Joining my group I am currently looking for PhD students to work with me. To get a better sense of my work and what my previous student collaborators have achieved please see the students page and the publications page. Please read how to join before emailing me. Selected Publications Full list of publications here Hypothesis Testing the Circuit Hypothesis in LLMs C Shi, N Beltran-Velez, A Nazaret, C Zheng, A Garriga-Alonso, A Jesson, M Makar, D Blei NeurIPS 2024 [workshop version, full paper forthcoming] Offline policy evaluation and optimization under confounding C Kausik, Y Lu, K Tan, M Makar, Y Wang, A Tewari AIStats 2024 [paper] Partial identification of the maximum mean discrepancy with mismeasured data R. Nafshi, M. Makar UAI, 2024 [paper] Causally motivated multi-shortcut identification and removal J. Zheng, M. Makar NeurIPS 2022 [paper] Page generated 2024-10-12 19:16:49 EDT, by jemdoc.
